data.title: Intel GL Fix
data.body: Removes a completely pointless macro that Intel GL drivers don't like.

data.title: VS2017 compiler workaround
data.body: Works around the regressive behavior in the VSC++ compiler for VS2017 where the variadic templates would not compile correctly. Issue should be patched in future versions, so for now it'll target the 1910 version specifically.

data.title: Implementation of sRGB image support
data.body: Overhauls the linearization setup to utilize the sRGB image types, as well as refactors the use of ColorF and ColorI to be properly internally consistent. ColorIs are used only for front-facing/editing/UI settings, and ColorFs, now renamed to LinearColorF to reduce confusion of purpose, are used for color info in the engine itself. This avoids confusing and expensive conversions back and forth between types and avoids botches with linearity. Majority work done by @rextimmy

data.title: Srgb texture improvements
data.body: Implements sRGB texture format support and shifts the engine over to utilize it, trimming out a good deal of overhead for the gamma/linear corrections, and making everything tidier.

data.title: PhysX 3.4 support
data.body:
Attempt number 2.

PhysX 3.4 support, tested on windows 10, linux mint 18.1 and macOS sierra. Added a new console variable called $Physics::gpuAccelerationAllowed (disabled by default). When enabled physx will attempt to create a cuda context and if successful will enable Gpu Rigid Body(GRB) support.  If no supported nvidia hardware is found, a simple warning will be put in the log and it will than resort back to using the cpu dispatcher for everything.

GRB support is only available on windows and linux.

data.title: PhysX 3.4 support
data.body: Adds support for PhysX 3.4 and also adds support for macOS & linux. Tested it with Windows 10, Linux mint 18.1 & macOS sierra.

data.title: ForceFOV is not working on GuiTSControl.
data.body:
The definition of frustum is already made. Changing mLastCameraQuery.fov on _internalRender is ignored. It has to be changed before frustum is defined.

Note: With this PR ForceFOV will not work on Render Stereo modes. I don't know it this is important...

data.title: Removes Direct3D9 functionality.
data.body: Removes the aging D3D9 support in favor of better functionality support for modern OGL and D3D11.

data.title: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D into…
data.body: … development

data.title: Solves issue with getDesktopResolution and Windows 10 Creator update
data.body: Solves issue #2013

data.title: GetDesktopResolution returns 0 0 0 as resolution after Windows10 Creators update
data.body:
It seems that getDesktopResolution() (used in configureCanvas in script) returns 0 0 0 as resolution, therefor making the following resolution check unreliable.

After a debugging session it looks like ::EnumDisplaySettings(NULL, ENUM_REGISTRY_SETTINGS, &devMode) in Win32WindowManager.cpp is causing all the trouble.

data.title: Fixes a redundant flag test
data.body: As per issue #1998. Credit to @maddin200 for the find.

data.title: Cleans up a redundant include.
data.body: As per issue #1999. Credit to @maddin200  for the find.

data.title: Catches the remaining prepass to deferred changes on the engine side.
data.body: Missed a few conversions of prepass to deferred in the engine side. This should get the remainder.

data.title: Console Classes dump allocation fix
data.body:
Console Classes dump fix. It was running aground on having a case where there was a empty string value for the 'usage' field in the class header. This would break the allocation because we're allocating nothing. This rejects it if the usage field is an empty string.

This is in reference to issue #2005.

data.title: BugFix for GFXDrawUtil::drawTextN()
data.body:
This PR fixes a bug that was causing GFXDrawUtil::drawTextN() to draw one character more than requested if in_string is longer than n. This bug shows up in the GuiMessageVectorCtrl when lines are split. The first character of the second part of the string is duplicated on the line above. You can trace through from here: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gui/game/guiMessageVectorCtrl.cpp#L717 to see it happen, if you have a control with split lines.
Specifically,
GFX->getDrawUtil()->drawTextN(mProfile->mFont, start, "0123456789", 5, mProfile->mFontColors, mMaxColorIndex, 0.0f);
will render 6 characters instead of 5 as requested.

data.title: GCC segfaults when compiling engineFunctions.h
data.body:
Ubuntu 14.04.5 - x86_64 - Kernel 3.13.0.117-generic
gcc (Ubuntu 4.8.4-2ubuntu1~14.04.3) 4.8.4 (stock GCC compiler)

When building Torque3D's development branch, GCC 4.8.4 will generate a segmentation fault:

```
In file included from /home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/consoleObject.h:45:0,
                 from /home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/simObject.h:30,
                 from /home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/simBase.h:33,
                 from /home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/app/badWordFilter.cpp:26:
/home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/engineFunctions.h: In substitution of ‘template<class ... ArgTs> template<class T> using DefVST = typename EngineTypeTraits<T>::DefaultArgumentValueStoreType [with T = const char*; ArgTs = {<expression error>}]’:
/home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/engineFunctions.h:116:93:   required from ‘static _EngineFunctionDefaultArguments<void(ArgTs ...)>::MaybeSelfEnabled<TailTs ...> _EngineFunctionDefaultArguments<void(ArgTs ...)>::tailInit(TailTs ...) [with TailTs = {const char*, const char*}; ArgTs = {const char*, const char*}; _EngineFunctionDefaultArguments<void(ArgTs ...)>::MaybeSelfEnabled<TailTs ...> = std::tuple<const char*, const char*>]’
/home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/engineFunctions.h:122:91:   required from ‘_EngineFunctionDefaultArguments<void(ArgTs ...)>::_EngineFunctionDefaultArguments(TailTs ...) [with TailTs = {const char*, const char*}; ArgTs = {const char*, const char*}]’
/home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/app/badWordFilter.cpp:257:1:   required from here
/home/gstewart/dev/Torque3D/Engine/source/console/engineFunctions.h:116:93: internal compiler error: Segmentation fault
       SelfType::copyHelper<TailTs...>(argsT, tailT, typename Gens<sizeof...(TailTs)>::type());
                                                                                             ^
Please submit a full bug report,
with preprocessed source if appropriate.
See <file:///usr/share/doc/gcc-4.8/README.Bugs> for instructions.
Preprocessed source stored into /tmp/cckocAvX.out file, please attach this to your bugreport.
...
```


Steps to reproduce:
1. On Ubuntu 14.04 with GCC 4.8.4, run the following cmake:
cmake ../../../.. -DTORQUE_APP_NAME=MyGame -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release -DVIDEO_MIR=0

2. Run make

Note: Torque3D compiles without issue on the 3.10 release (only development has this issue).  While this does look like a bug with GCC, the fact that this GCC version is the stock one that comes with Ubuntu 14.04 LTS might be worth creating a workaround for.

data.title: dumpConsoleClasses() crashes torque
data.body:
dumpConsoleClasses() crashes torque.

i was using: 
ubuntu 16.04.
torque 3.10 (last commit c460868814f1b41c954fdd963ea9a7f60c017f18 )
self compiled binaries and default game template via $ make install

Tail of the output: https://pastebin.com/nuehK2in

dumpConsoleFunctions(), dumpEngineDocs("foo") and playing a little bit the default game template worked.

data.title: Ups the #pragma pack call from 4 to 8 when using 64bit
data.body: ps the #pragma pack call from 4 to 8 when using 64bit, as per suggested settings. This shaves off a lot of compatibility warnings.

data.title: Prepass->Deferred rename for full template
data.body: Does the Prepass->Deferred rename on the full template to make it keep functionality while we prep to swap over to the BaseGame template.
